ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:0.5_0: 58. The training rule on holding a staff
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six gave teachings to people holding a staff. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not give a teaching to anyone holding a staff who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:1.6_0: What is longer than that is not a staff, nor what is shorter.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:1.7_0: One should not give a teaching to anyone holding a staff who is not sick.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:1.8_0: If a monk out, of disrespect, gives a teaching to someone holding a staff who is not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:1.10.1_0: or it has not been trusted ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:1.12_0: The eighth rule, the training rule on weavers, is finished.
